change_log: Added saturation thresholds for category reports (saturation_saturated, saturation_mainstream, saturation_emerging, saturation_gap).

binding_guide.markers: Access via labels.marker_1.marker_name, labels.marker_1.slider_a_title, labels.marker_1.territory_1_title, etc.

marker_1.intro_description: You have ingredients (Mass) and marketing spend (Force). But without Purpose, you have no Direction. This isn't about "saving the world"; it's the fundamental calculation the customer's brain makes in milliseconds: "Does this exist to Fix me, Protect me, or Elevate me?" If the PDP doesn't transmit this signal instantly, you aren't a brand. You are just a commodity with a logo.
marker_1.slider_a_title: [SLIDER] ORIGIN OF AUTHORITY (The Source of Power)
marker_1.territory_1_description: We treat skin issues as pathologies, not flaws. The PDP is a prescription pad: clinical data, sterile visuals, and molecular repair. We don't pamper; we cure.
marker_1.territory_2_description: We engineer shields against the modern world. The PDP emphasizes immunity, SPF, and barrier defense. We don't wait for damage to happen; we prevent the environment from touching you.
marker_1.territory_3_description: We restore equilibrium using biology, not chemistry. The PDP proves that nature fixes what the city broke. It's about gentleness, not force.
marker_1.territory_4_description: We treat the mind, not just the face. The PDP sells dopamine and confidence, ignoring "flaws" entirely. It's not medicine; it's a psychological unlock.

marker_2.intro_description: Most brands treat Mission as a poetic slogan. Wrong. On the digital shelf, Mission is a targeting system. It defines the Blast Radius of your ambition. The customer subconsciously calculates this instantly: "Is this brand trying to fix a specific pimple, or is it trying to save the planet?" "Is this club for the elite few, or the democratic many?" If the PDP doesn't define the size of the battlefield, you aren't a leader. You are a bystander.
marker_2.slider_b_score_1: ▼ The Velvet Rope (Gatekept by price or license)
marker_2.slider_b_score_4: ▼ Approachable (Easy to find, easy to buy)
marker_2.territory_1_description: We strip away the mystery and the markup. The PDP proves skin health isn't a privilege. Simple ingredients, ruthlessly efficient. It's not "cheap"; it's smart.
marker_2.territory_2_description: We push the boundaries of biotechnology. The PDP signals "advanced warfare" against aging via patents and complex molecules. If you ask the price, you can't afford the results.
marker_2.territory_3_description: We save the planet through skincare. The product is secondary to the impact (Zero Waste, Cruelty-Free). You don't just buy a moisturizer; you buy a clear conscience.
marker_2.territory_4_description: We sell a worldview, not just a lotion. The PDP is a manifesto that requires "education" to decode. We don't want everyone; we want the right ones.

marker_3.intro_description: Values aren't inspirational posters on a breakroom wall. On the digital shelf, they are the Operating Code that resolves conflict. When "High Potency" clashes with "Sensitive Skin," which one wins? When "Marketing Magic" clashes with "Raw Data," what do you show? The PDP reveals the brand's true hierarchy of laws. It tells the customer: "We will sacrifice X to give you Y." We map this because you can't be "Safe" and "Aggressive" at the same time.
marker_3.slider_b_score_1: ▼ The Spec Sheet (Exact percentages, pH, sourcing)
marker_3.slider_b_score_5: ▼ The Black Box (Trust our secret complex)
marker_3.territory_1_description: Code: "Do No Harm." The PDP is a medical clearance form. They sacrifice potency to guarantee absolute tolerance.
marker_3.territory_2_description: Code: "Show the Receipts." The PDP is a lab report listing every percentage. They sacrifice mystery to treat you like a chemist.
marker_3.territory_3_description: Code: "Respect the Source." The PDP relies on the mystique of nature. They sacrifice hard data to build bonds based on legacy.
marker_3.territory_4_description: Code: "Results at All Costs." The PDP sells a proprietary miracle. They sacrifice transparency to sell the dream of transformation.

marker_4.intro_description: Positioning isn't a slide in a pitch deck; it is the specific parking spot you occupy in the customer's brain. The brain hates chaos, so it simplifies brands into archetypes to save energy. On the PDP, you are either the Doctor or the Model. You are either a Utility or a Luxury. You cannot be both. We scan for this because if you try to park in two spots at once, you get towed.
marker_4.territory_1_description: Spot: The Pharmacy. The PDP is boring on purpose to signal safety. You don't buy it to feel cool; you buy it because it works.
marker_4.territory_2_description: Spot: The Med-Spa. The PDP uses clinical codes to justify a high price. The signal: "Serious science costs money."
marker_4.territory_3_description: Spot: The Supermarket. The PDP is warm, soft, and safe. It sacrifices "Cool" to be the reliable choice for the whole house.
marker_4.territory_4_description: Spot: Sephora. The PDP is designed to be looked at. You buy it because it makes your bathroom counter look better.

marker_5.intro_description: If Archetype is the Role you play, Personality is how you behave in the room. Based on Jennifer Aaker's Dimensions, we measure the behavioral traits the PDP projects. Does the brand act like a distant, sterile surgeon (High Competence, Low Warmth)? Or like a hyper-active cheerleader (High Excitement, High Warmth)? We map this because customers don't just buy products; they buy the energy of the entity selling them.
marker_5.territory_1_description: The brand behaves like a trusted friend. The PDP signals honesty, warmth, and "realness." It avoids jargon and pretension. Keywords: Down-to-earth, Original, Cheerful. Perception: "Safe, Family-Friendly, Honest."
marker_5.territory_2_description: Behaves like a cool influencer. Signals energy, youth, and risk. It breaks visual rules to stay viral. Keywords: Daring, Spirited, Contemporary. Perception: "Cool, Viral, Fun."
marker_5.territory_3_description: The brand behaves like a scientist or doctor. The PDP signals intelligence, success, and hard work. It sacrifices emotion for precision. Keywords: Reliable, Intelligent, Corporate. Perception: "Effective, Smart, Serious."
marker_5.territory_4_description: Behaves like the elite. The PDP signals charm, class, and exclusivity. It uses negative space and refined language to build desire. Keywords: Upper Class, Charming, Glamorous. Perception: "Expensive, Status, Beautiful."

marker_6.intro_description: Archetypes aren't tarot cards; they are efficiency hacks for the human brain. The brain is lazy. It wants to categorize you instantly to save energy. "Is this brand the Teacher (Sage) or the Rebel (Outlaw)?" On a PDP, you cannot be complex. If you try to be everything, you become nothing--a "grey blur" that the brain filters out as noise. We map this to confirm you have chosen a specific Character Role that the customer can instantly recognize and trust.
marker_6.archetype_group_a_description: Offers certainty in a chaotic world. The PDP signals protection, absolute perfection, and structure. Safe, not sorry.
marker_6.archetype_group_b_description: Exists to overthrow the status quo. The PDP signals intensity, rule-breaking, and transformation. Results at any cost.
marker_6.archetype_group_c_description: Prioritizes the tribe over the product. The PDP signals warmth, inclusivity, and sensory fun. It feels like a club.
marker_6.archetype_group_d_description: Driven by the search for answers. The PDP signals purity, simplicity, and raw data. A return to the source.
marker_6.archetype_caregiver_description: The Altruist. Driven to protect and nurture others.
marker_6.archetype_ruler_description: The Boss. Driven to create order and prosperity.
marker_6.archetype_creator_description: The Architect. Driven to imagine and build the new.
marker_6.archetype_sage_description: The Scholar. Driven to understand the world through data.
marker_6.archetype_innocent_description: The Idealist. Driven by purity, simplicity, and faith.
marker_6.archetype_explorer_description: The Seeker. Driven by autonomy and new experiences.
marker_6.archetype_hero_description: The Warrior. Driven to prove worth through action.
marker_6.archetype_magician_description: The Visionary. Driven to turn dreams into reality.
marker_6.archetype_outlaw_description: The Rebel. Driven to break rules that don't work.
marker_6.archetype_everyman_description: The Neighbor. Driven to fit in and connect.
marker_6.archetype_jester_description: The Entertainer. Driven to live in the moment.
marker_6.archetype_lover_description: The Partner. Driven by desire and connection.
marker_6.territory_1_description: Offers certainty in a chaotic world. The PDP signals protection, absolute perfection, and structure. Safe, not sorry.
marker_6.territory_2_description: Driven by the search for answers. The PDP signals purity, simplicity, and raw data. A return to the source.
marker_6.territory_3_description: Prioritizes the tribe over the product. The PDP signals warmth, inclusivity, and sensory fun. It feels like a club.
marker_6.territory_4_description: Exists to overthrow the status quo. The PDP signals intensity, rule-breaking, and transformation. Results at any cost.

marker_7.intro_description: Tone of Voice isn't about what you say; it is the frequency you broadcast on. On a PDP, the customer isn't reading; they are listening to the vibe. Are you a lecturer or a drinking buddy? A scientist or a cheerleader? We measure these 4 dimensions because a mismatch between your Product (Serious) and your Voice (Silly) creates cognitive dissonance. And confusion kills conversion.
marker_7.slider_a_score_3: ▼ Light (Pleasant, not trying to be funny)
marker_7.territory_1_description: Sounds like a diagnosis. Zero humor, purely informational. Builds trust through distance and precision.
marker_7.territory_2_description: Sounds like an instruction manual. Short sentences. No fluff. Builds trust through absolute efficiency.
marker_7.territory_3_description: Sounds like a good neighbor. Cheerful, polite, and encouraging. Builds trust through kindness and simplicity.
marker_7.territory_4_description: Sounds like a text message. Uses slang, emojis, and high energy. Builds trust through vulnerability and fun.

marker_8.intro_description: Your customer processes visuals 60,000 times faster than text. Before they read a word, their brain has already decoded your Vibe (Safe vs. Fun) and looked for your Anchors (Codes). We measure this in two layers: First, the Positioning (Are you a Hospital or a Playground?). Second, the Distinctive Assets (The specific colors, shapes, and characters that act as mental shortcuts). If you lack these anchors, you are invisible.
marker_8.territory_1_description: Clinical white and medical blue. The aesthetics of the lab. Signals safety, rigor, and zero risk.
marker_8.territory_2_description: Neons, stickers, and chaos. The aesthetics of the playground. Signals fun, youth, and dopamine.
marker_8.territory_3_description: Warm beige and paper textures. The aesthetics of the spa. Signals nature, gentleness, and calm.
marker_8.territory_4_description: Sharp lines and black void. The aesthetics of the art gallery. Signals status, price, and silence.

marker_9.intro_description: Messaging isn't about writing long paragraphs; it's about the Hook. On the digital shelf, the customer reads your Headline and maybe one sub-header. That's it. In those 2 seconds, you either hook them with a Molecule (Logic) or a Dream (Emotion). We measure this to see if your "Hook" matches your "Product." If you sell a commodity moisturizer but speak like a poet, the customer detects the lie.
marker_9.territory_1_description: Sells the noun. Assumes the user is smart enough to know the chemistry. Feels like a hardware store.
marker_9.territory_2_description: Sells the relief. Identifies a specific pain point and offers a mechanical fix. Feels like a clinic.
marker_9.territory_3_description: Sells the reflection. Ignores the "how" to focus entirely on the "wow." Feels like a magazine.
marker_9.territory_4_description: Sells the source. Elevates raw ingredients into romantic elements using poetic language. Feels like a spa.

marker_10.intro_description: A product needs a factory; a brand needs a birth certificate. On the digital shelf, the "Story" isn't a fairy tale; it is the Trust Anchor. It answers the question: "Who birthed this, and why?" Did a scientist create it after 20 years of research? Or did a sufferer create it because nothing else worked? We map this because customers trust Authority (The Doctor) and Empathy (The Sufferer) in completely different ways.
marker_10.slider_a_score_5: ▼ The Survivor (Founder who cured own pain)
marker_10.territory_1_description: Born from research. The story is about time, patents, and rigor. "We studied this molecule for 10 years." Trust is built on data.
marker_10.territory_2_description: Born from struggle. The story is about the founder's pain (acne, eczema) and their quest to fix it. Trust is built on shared suffering.
marker_10.territory_3_description: Born from synthesis. The story is about using science to unlock the power of plants. "Powered by Nature, Proven by Science." Trust is built on best-of-both-worlds.
marker_10.territory_4_description: Born from wisdom. The story is about rediscovering an ancient secret or ingredient (Geisha secrets, Glacial water). Trust is built on heritage.

marker_11.intro_description: Claims are cheap; proof is currency. On the digital shelf, the customer is a skeptic. They are looking for the "Reason to Believe" (RTB). KSPs are the bullets you fire to kill that skepticism. We measure this because you cannot win with every weapon. You either win with Authority (The Doctor) or Popularity (The Crowd). You win with Hard Data (Charts) or Soft Vibes (Texture). If you try to fire all guns at once, you miss the target.
marker_11.slider_a_score_4: ▼ The Users (Percentage of users who agree)
marker_11.slider_b_score_2: ▼ The Stat (95% saw reduction in acne)
marker_11.slider_b_score_5: ▼ The Feel (Focus on texture, scent, absorption)
marker_11.territory_1_description: Relies on the white coat. Evidence is clinical studies and doctor recommendations. Trust the expert.
marker_11.territory_2_description: Relies on the checklist. Evidence is "Free-From" claims and safety certifications. Trust the ingredients.
marker_11.territory_3_description: Relies on the crowd. Evidence is Before/After photos and user statistics. Trust the hype.
marker_11.territory_4_description: Relies on the vibe. Evidence is texture, scent, and "glow" descriptions. Trust the feeling.

marker_12.intro_description: The USP is the sharpest knife in the drawer. It is not a list of features; it is the one thing you own that no one else can steal. On a digital shelf, the customer's brain tries to pigeonhole you instantly. "Oh, this is the Oat Brand." "This is the Cheap Retinol." "This is the KP Bump Fixer." We measure this because if your USP is everything, it is nothing. You must own one specific hill to die on.
marker_12.slider_a_title: [SLIDER] THE OWNERSHIP OBJECT (What You Claim to Own)
marker_12.slider_a_score_2: ▼ The Hero (Owned mental link: "We are the Oat brand")
marker_12.slider_b_title: [SLIDER] THE TARGET SCOPE (How Wide Is The Net?)
marker_12.slider_b_score_1: ▼ The Price (USP is low cost: "The Ordinary")
marker_12.slider_b_score_2: ▼ The Value (High potency for fair price)
marker_12.territory_1_description: Owns the mental link to one substance. "We are the Oat brand." "We are the Snail Mucin brand." Trust is based on the source.
marker_12.territory_2_description: It's not what is in it, but how it gets into the skin. "MVE Delivery Technology." Trust is based on the proprietary engineering.
marker_12.territory_3_description: Clinical potency at drugstore prices. "The $10 Retinol." They commoditize the active ingredients. Trust is based on the lack of markup.
marker_12.territory_4_description: The absolute go-to for a niche problem. "The Chicken Skin Fix." "The Post-Laser Balm." Trust is based on hyper-focus.

marker_13.intro_description: Messaging is what you say; Focus is what you do. On a PDP, you have limited pixels. How you spend them reveals your true priority. Are you allocating space to 80% diagrams (Science) or 80% vibes (Lifestyle)? We measure this because brands often lie in their copy but tell the truth in their layout. If you claim "Clinical Rigor" but your page is just influencers dancing, the diagnostics reveal a lie.
marker_13.territory_1_description: The PDP is a classroom. Diagrams and molecules dominate. Trust is built on hard logic.
marker_13.territory_2_description: The PDP is a community board. Before & Afters dominate. Trust is built on the crowd.
marker_13.territory_3_description: The PDP is a mood board. Textures and shelfies dominate. Trust is built on pure desire.
marker_13.territory_4_description: The PDP is a catalog. Packshots and bundles dominate. The goal is transaction speed.

marker_14.intro_description: This is the "Job to be Done." Customers don't buy cream; they buy a result. On the PDP, the promise is binary: either you are Stopping Damage (Prevention) or Fixing Damage (Restoration). Either you are improving Health (Biology) or Looks (Vanity). We measure this because a customer in pain (Eczema) doesn't care about "Glow," and a customer seeking "Glass Skin" doesn't care about "Microbiome Balance."
marker_14.territory_1_description: Fixes a broken barrier. Stops the itch, heals cracks, and soothes. The goal is urgent recovery.
marker_14.territory_2_description: Shields against the world. SPF, antioxidants, and anti-pollution. The goal is total defense.
marker_14.territory_3_description: Pumps water into cells. Plumps, softens, and relieves tightness. The goal is moisture balance.
marker_14.territory_4_description: Changes how skin looks. Brightens tone, smooths lines, and erases spots. The goal is visual perfection.

marker_15.intro_description: Functional is what the product does to the skin; Emotional is what it does to the mind. On the PDP, we measure the "Psychological Payoff." Are you selling the absence of pain (Relief) or the presence of joy (Reward)? Are you validating the user's private feelings (Safety) or their public capability (Confidence)? We map this because a customer with Eczema buys "Safety," while a customer buying $300 La Mer buys "Superiority."
marker_15.slider_a_score_1: ▼ Panic Mode (Urgent need to stop pain/itch)
marker_15.slider_a_score_3: ▼ Contentment (The feeling of a job well done)
marker_15.slider_b_score_1: ▼ Sanctuary (I feel safe inside my own body)
marker_15.slider_b_score_3: ▼ Readiness (I am ready to face the day)
marker_15.slider_b_score_4: ▼ Savvy (I feel smart/validated for choosing this)
marker_15.territory_1_description: The absence of worry. "I don't have to stress about a reaction." It sells peace of mind and security.
marker_15.territory_2_description: The removal of insecurity. "I can face the world without hiding." It sells the ability to be seen.
marker_15.territory_3_description: The presence of joy. "I deserve this moment." It sells a dopamine hit and a private moment of luxury.
marker_15.territory_4_description: The feeling of being smart. "I didn't fall for the marketing; I bought the science." It sells savvy.

marker_16.intro_description: This isn't about what the product does for you; it's about what the product says about you. Every purchase is a vote for a specific identity. When a customer puts a jar on their bathroom counter, they are signaling a value system. Are they the Rational Skeptic who rejects marketing? Or the Elite Insider who demands the best? We measure this because "who I am" often overrides "what I need."
marker_16.slider_a_score_2: ▼ The Smart Choice (because it makes sense)
marker_16.slider_a_score_3: ▼ The Balance (It works well and looks good)
marker_16.slider_a_score_4: ▼ The Statement (I buy it to show my taste)
marker_16.slider_a_score_5: ▼ The Avatar (I buy it to define who I am)
marker_16.slider_b_score_1: ▼ The Standard (What everyone uses; the default)
marker_16.slider_b_score_4: ▼ The Insider (Hard to find; "if you know, you know")
marker_16.slider_b_score_5: ▼ The Exclusive (Gatekept by price or access)
marker_16.territory_1_description: "I don't fall for marketing fluff; I buy what works." Signals intelligence and immunity to hype. The badge of the realist.
marker_16.territory_2_description: "I know what is cool right now." Signals social awareness and youth. The badge of the person who is plugged in.
marker_16.territory_3_description: "I care about the details." Signals moral superiority or deep knowledge. The badge of the ethical or educated buyer.
marker_16.territory_4_description: "I can afford the absolute best." Signals financial power and taste. The badge of the elite.

marker_17.intro_description: Humans are herd animals. We don't just buy products to use them; we buy them to signal where we belong in the hierarchy. On the PDP, the brand offers you a membership card. It asks: "Do you want to join the Majority (Safety)? Or do you want to join the Elite (Status)?" "Do you want to look like a Smart Insider or a Good Citizen?" We measure this because buying a brand is often the price of admission to a specific social tribe.
marker_17.slider_a_score_1: ▼ Normalization ("I want to look like everyone else")
marker_17.slider_a_score_2: ▼ Acceptance ("I want to be accepted by the group")
marker_17.slider_a_score_5: ▼ Separation ("I want to be unlike the rest")
marker_17.territory_1_description: The feeling of safety in numbers. "Everyone uses this, so I can't go wrong." It connects you to the mainstream majority.
marker_17.territory_2_description: The feeling of being "In the Know." Connects you to a tribe of educated skintellectuals. "We are the smart ones."
marker_17.territory_3_description: The feeling of moral action. Connects you to a movement (Vegan/Clean). "I stand out because I do the right thing."
marker_17.territory_4_description: The feeling of access. Connects you to the elite few. "I have this because I know where to find it, and you don't."
